item.title: Spectator
item.description: Spectator I was, for so long, like the rescued, putting muscle to the banks of the riverwater, listening, to the voice, the jerking seat of the merciless weather, once wrapped in steel skin, now hung, like a fly strip, flapping, out like God, like some dirty wave, my freezing bones, my dull myth- ologized self, now I’m a snake, coiled up among debris, or buried, in costume, renaming the remains, always

item.title: Bodhi
item.description: Bodhi Paper on panel, 8 x 10 in. Dean Mirabito is an artist and dilettante based in Boston. He is an editor at Spiderbite.

item.title: About
item.description: We are convinced that we are dominating energy and matter.
